review_body: There are 3 of us for this trip and we have decided to choose Hotel Sardonyx Tokyo since we read all the good comments from others in TripAdvisor. Unlike most of other hotels in Tokyo, the room is fairly big for the 3 of us and for 3 big luggages. It’s clean and comfortable. The location is also good, just 1 stop from the Tokyo Station. Surrounding is more quiet compared to the other busiest hotels in Tokyo which we normally stayed before. Hence, we liked it very much, not crowded like in other places. Nearby this hotel, we can find many restaurants and convenient stores. Front Desk people are very friendly and helpful. Overall, we had a very good stay in this hotel and will definitely come back to stay here whenever we have another opportunities to visit Tokyo.

Hotel was in great location,near to everything we need-train station,resto and shops but still very quiet. Front desk staff are very helpful,our room is always fresh and clean daily. They are very generous with everything like toiletries. Laundry room was very helpful to us since we stay for a week. Breakfast are not the best but good enough for the price you pay. Would definitely recommend Hotel Sardnoyx Tokyo to everyone.

We stayed here on 2 occasions. Location wise, it’s superb ie 3 mins walk to Hatchobori station which is one station away from Tokyo station. It’s also near to TCAT if you which to take bus to Haneda/Narita airport. It would cost about 700-800 yen for a taxi ride. U also have Lawson and Sugi Drug store nearby. Service staff was generally helpful. We booked a twin room and we found the room rather spacious by Tokyo’s standards. The hotel also provided additional toiletries to select at the lobby. Overall, we were happy with the hotel

Stayed here for 4 nights. The breakfast buffet is quite nice. Walking distance to the metro station. 7-11 and Family mart is just around the corner. There are many nice restaurant within 15 min walking distance. Have a coin operated laundry room but there's only 2 washer & 2 dryer. On thing I'm displeased is this hotel charges 2000 yen for a baby cot/night. This is the only hotel I encounter in my whole Japan trip that charges for baby cot.

The hotel was located right next to subway station, it had nice restaurants, bars and cafe around. Located in ideal place to go around Tokyo.If you don't mind walking for 15-20 minutes, you can walk to Tsukiji market when you have jetleg and go to 24 hour sushi restaurant.

Hotel Sardonyx is a comfortable hotel. Everything about the hotel is average. Location, comfort, service, cost and amenities are all OK. I would not highly recommend the hotel or would not advise not stay. In general, you can get better, but for Tokyo priced hotels, this hotel is good value for money. My only criticism is that we stayed during the recent Typhoon Habilis and besides informing us that there would be no room service on the day of the typhoon which was understandable, however there was no information provided in how to hope with a possible emergency situation. Fortunately we found thus in the internet,

Nice spot to land for four nights. Clean, comfortable and spacious for Japan room. Convenient to Hatchobori station which is a half block away and Tokyo Station at a 15 minute walk. Add to this that it was economical and Sardonyx was a win, win, win. Would recommend it and will stay here again!

A business type hotel with spacious enough room, beds and bathroom. Although there wasn’t any non-smoking room available, the room in the smoking level was clean and free of odor but the corridor still had smoke smell. But the hotel can do more to help customers change to non-smoking room if available. The hotel provides tea/coffee dispenser in the ground level (but the coffee didn’t work when I tried to use it twice). There’s also free sanitary items to take from the hotel lobby like mouth wash, shower products and tea. The hotel is across the road from A4 exit of Hatchobori station on Hibiya line. Very convenient but note there is NO lift from the underground of station to ground level. You must carry your luggage up the steep stairs. There’s also JR interchange at Hatchobori station which is convenient to go Disneyland. Nearby there’s Lawson store, eateries like Denny’s, ramen and even drug store and supermarket. Walking distance to TCAT airport transfer 15 min. Walking distance to Ningyocho eating street 20 min. Generally a good place to stay in Tokyo. Easily accessible and value pricing.

Did not provide cot for free (additional 2k yen per night). Realized Fridge did not close properly when came back at night led to my grocery spoil. Cleaner also moved the luggage (turned it around) and did not move back to original place. Not satisfied with the services.

We stayed in Hotel Sardonyx as a family of 4 (2 adults, 2 kids (7 and9)).We arrived early (9ish) on our first day and weren’t expecting to get our room until the afternoon and were pleasantly surprised when told we had access straight away. This set the tone for the stay. The hotel staff are all very friendly and cannot do enough to help.The hotel itself is also very good, the location is convenient as Hatchobori station is virtually opposite, the amenities are great, we were pleasantly surprised that they provide washer and drier to do your own laundry (at a minimal cost).All in all, highly recommended.

Its a good 15 minutes walk from Tokyo Station but of you come out of Hatchobori Station via exit 4, its only about 50m away! Reception were friendly and helpful and could speak English. The lift system inside the hotel is quick and efficient. Room size was fine and everything was clean and comfy. Aircon worked very well.The attached restaurant provided breakfast which was an eclectic mix in a buffet. Hash browns, spring rolls, fried chcken, sausage and scrambled egg were all available plus some local stuff like dim sum, miso soup, porridge and pickled fish. There was also fruit, salad and cereals.Couldn't really fault the place and can definitely recommend it as a base for exploring Tokyo. 50m and you're on the train network! It doesn't get much easier.There are three mini markets in the immediate neighbourhood and plenty of options for eating out.

This hotel is great. Very large rooms by Tokyo standards, very convenient location, and extremely helpful staff. Great views of a busy intersection and a sleepy canal as well. The laundry on the 4th floor also has 2 washing machines for ¥300 each and 2 dryers for ¥100 for 30 minutes.

Ambience: 5/5Cleanliness: 5/5Location: 5/5Customer Service: 4/5Value for Money: 5/5This was our base camp for our Tokyo leg of our family trip, very spacious, great for families with children, prices are affordable for the room space given, and it came with free breakfast, so this one was a yes for us, and we are definitely coming back again when we are back in Japan!

We stayed here for a few nights when we first got to Tokyo and it was perfect. It's across the street from a subway stop so it's super easy to get around. The room was big and spacious, we missed this room in our next Japan hotels which were smaller. The room was clean, the staff was helpful, and the location was great. The breakfast included in our package was also good.

Convenient location - near banks, subway station, small restaurants and convenience stores. Small restaurant off lobby serving Eastern or Western breakfast. Friendly and helpful staff. Coin laundry in hotel - 300 yen to wash a load and 100 yen for dryer. Amenities bar (lotions, comb, etc.) in lobby along with coffee, tea, and cocoa. Rooms are nice size with lots of electrical outlets, refrigerator, hot pot, and kettle. In room safe and good wi-fi. Good desk lamp and adjustable reading light near bed.

A very good value hotel a short walk from Tokyo station, meaning great access to the Tokyo area and further afield. It perfectly suited us for what we needed, a place to crash after a long day of exploring.

We stayed here as this hotel was close to the Keiyo Line which takes you direct to Disney. The hotel is just a 2 minute walk from the station. This was the most spacious room we had during our trip to Japan, which is rare for hotels in Japan as they are normally very small. As we stayed here halfway during our trip, we used the laundry facilities. The washing machine was 300 Yen per wash, the dryer was 100 Yen for 30 minutes. We were given a smoking room as there were no other rooms at the hotel and they were fully booked. As a non-smoker, this was a little off putting because as soon as you walked in the room you could smell stale smoke. They did provide air freshener and after about a day we managed to cover the smell. The bed was comfortable and the shower and bath were good too. This was also the only hotel that had an actual wardrobe in it, so plenty of storage space for clothes unlike other hotels in Japan that only offer one coat hanger per person. We had breakfast here too, which was very good. There was a variety of Western and Japanese options, such as cereal, pastries and breads, scrambled eggs, hash browns, yoghurt, fruit and drinks. Breakfast is served between 6.30am -9.45am.

It's our first-time to stay in this hotel. And we were pleasantly surprised that the room was actually big considering it's in Tokyo. We were also coming from Osaka where our hotel was a lot smaller so when we arrived, my son was so happy to see that we had an L-shaped sofa, a table and a desk, an actual living area beside our big bed. We also had a nice view of the city from our room. Our bathroom had a tub and they provided pajamas for us. It was a really comfortably stay in Tokyo.We also got to check-in easily the moment we arrived. There's a good restaurant at the bottom of the hotel that serves a lot of options great for families and kids.The hotel is just quite a long walk to Tokyo station and the malls like Takashimaya and the shopping areas. But Hatchobori station is just right across. It says to be nearby Ginza but we didn't get to go there anymore as it was still quite a walk.Overall, we'll be happy to stay in this hotel again.

Have been to Tokyo for a 5th time now and I think I finally found good hotel that offers good price/value ratio.Great location - 50m from Hatchobori metro station so you are flexible to go anywhere in the city.Rooms are big in comparison to other hotels for a reasonable price. Breakfast is good with nice selection - mainly Japanese food and some croissants if you need smt. European.Definitely recommended!

A very nice stay in Sardonyx hotel. A very reasonable price. Rooms are large enough. It is very efficient located next to Ginza. Service is very japanese (kind, efficient....)Would recommand for a family trip.

This is my first time to stay in this hotel and we are so glad that we made a right choice ! The location of the hotel is very convenient as you can have JR or Metro stations in few mintues walk. If you want to go the Disneyland, Mitsui Outlet Park and Odaiba, here you can go easily through JR. There is a 24hours convenience store at the opposite side. The hotel restaurant serves till 02:00 and last order is 01:30. The food is great at a reasonable price. The front desk and coffee shop staff are nice although their English is not fluent but can be communicated. The breakfast varieties is acceptable and food is fresh. The wifi is fast. We are a family of 3 adults and a 3 years-old child stayed in a triple room. Child breakfast is free. The room is a three bed room and spacious enough to open our 3 three big suitcases and a baby stroller. It is rarely found in Tokyo hotels. The amenities provided in guest room and hotel lobby is great and hot/cold water and tea dispenser is located on lobby as well. There's a pantry on each floor which provides microwave, chopsticks, plastic folks and spoons. Self laundry machine is also available. From Narita airport to this hotel, you can take the limousine bus and get off at "TCAT", then take a taxi to hotel within 5 minutes in about 800yen. On your return back to Narita Aiport, you can do it same as "TCAT" is convenient and the staff is courteous. I have no hesitation in recommended this hotel !

Around the corner from Hatchōbori Station, Hotel Sardonyx overlooks a canal flowing into the Sumida River. Friendly, English-speaking reception staff and an adjoining restaurant (called the Royal Host). The buffet breakfast is satisfactory with a range of choices. The room was larger than the norm for Tokyo, with a separate chair for coffee/reading and a handy desk and office chair for working on the laptop. The room was quiet and the bed comfortable for sleeping. However, the room was hot when we arrived, and we struggled with instructions to get the air con working at a comfortable level for sleeping. Outside if you turn left at the entrance and continue walking along the main road you will cross the famous Tsukuda-ohashi bridge and reach the restaurants and supermarkets of Tsukuda. We had a late flight and the friendly staff kept our bags in concierge for the afternoon and called a taxi for us when we needed to travel to the Tokyo City Air Terminal T-CAT for the airport bus.

Our travel around Japan has brought us to many wonderful, comfortable and some remarkable accomodations. And the Hotel Sardonyx is one we have no qualms at recommending.We were met with warm and gracious staff the meeting we arrived. And as this is the last leg of our journey, it no longer surprise us that they also anticipated our arrival and subsequently rolled out our couriered bags the minute we started the check in process. We booked a room with two double beds and the room size is surprisingly on the larger end. It was very spacious, clean and the beds were comfortable. Guests may not notice but there is a stand by the foyer where they can help themselves to various personal hygiene items or a variety of tea and coffee as well.Other handy items is that the cafe opens till 2am! And they have a coin laundry on site too. Conveniently located near a train station, it is a short ride to Ginza and the Tsukiji fish market. For a decent and comfortable stay; convenience; close distance to key attractions; and even for just a tranquil view out of the window, we recommend this hotel.

Stayed with my husband and daughter for 6 nights last May in a double room. The room was quite spacious, and always cleaned immaculately. We fit comfortably in the queen bed, plenty of space for our luggage and room to spare for my kid to dance around. Hatchobori Station is very close by, making commuting by subway very easy. As I was having back pains, we took cabs quite often, and that was very convenient as well. The front desk staff were always ready to help, whether it was writing down our destination for the cab driver, hailing cabs or checking the schedule for Catholic mass.Also lots of convenience stores and pharmacies around the hotel. We enjoyed sampling snacks, breads and rice meals from Lawson and Family Mart. Highly recommend the Hotel for location, service, comfort and convenience.

Great hotel. Near subway and easily accessible. Staff nice. Room was comfortable and good breakfast with some American foods. Would recommend. Near 7-11 to get cash. Nice view of river. Not too expensive.

Location 5/5 if you don't mind a 15 minute walk to Tokyo Station. It is the main station you can use your JR Pass and catch the Shinkanzen (Bullet train). It is closer to the privately owned, non JR Pass subway of: Hatchobori (Hibiya Line), 4 mins walk. Kayobacho (Tozai Line), 4 mins walk if you get off the correct exit. The Tsujiki Outer Market is still there and is only 25 minute walk away. It is quite at night but is surrounded by restaurants and other places where the office workers go. Breakfast is good and plentiful buffet. But don't expect an American style it is Japan after all. The ladies there are so lovely. Wifi is fast. Rooms are clean and are big enough. You get PJs to wear as you normally do in most (if not all) decent hotels in Japan. A highly recommended hotel. The price was 125GBP including all taxes and breakfast, considering it was during the Sakura festival, it's great value. Will certainly stay here again next time.

I would definitely recommend this hotel. Probably the key thing I'd say is that they've thought of everything. Microwaves and vending machines (including a booze vending machine!) and ice mean that if you want to get dinner from 7-11 (this is very much 'a thing' in Japan, and is perfectly tasty) and eat in, you can. Being British, we valued having a fridge so we could make tea, too. And they've got whole racks of toiletries available, in addition to what's in the room. The hotel provides you with pretty much everything you could want.it's also a spacious place. We stayed in a standard double room and it was really very spacious, with plenty of room to set up laptop and suitcases. They provide dimensions for the rooms online, which is helpful (again, this is a thing in Japan).But do note: the double bed really is a double, and not a queen/king. Hotel Sardonyx is about a 15-20 minute walk from Tokyo station, but it is across the road from Hatchobori station, from which you can access the underground network and get anywhere. It's also about 15-20 minutes from the Tokyo airport limousine bus - which is well worth the extra 500 yen compared to the cost of taking trains. Breakfast included western and non-western options, which I really liked. Pickled veg is tough work in the morning, but who knew dim sum and fried noodles for breakfast would be so tasty?!Book with confidence. Though this hotel doesn't have lots and lots of bells and whistles and bellboys, it's a really well thought-out, considerate, and surprisingly quiet place to stay.

Booked this hotel online and after a 20 minute walk from Tokyo Station we were greeted by friendly staff. We found our room to be spacious and modern. The views were great and couldn’t hear the noise from the streets below. Once we worked out the subway system which is really close by we loved the spot. Disney is on the same line. Loved the vending machines for drinks. We really enjoyed our stay here and when in Tokyo again we’ll stay here.

Nice hotel about s 19 minutes walk from Tokyo central station. Lots of convenience stores and restaurants nearby. Rooms are large and clean and the bed is comfy. Good WiFi. I booked a smoking room by mistake and the brought in an air purifier that helps a lot.

The location of the hotel is perfect, next to the underground station, which the JR Express line from Tokyo station stops (1 stop). Be sure to locate the lift from the underground to street level and it's a short walk around the block from there. I stayed for 4 nights and with breakfast included. My room was a single (run of the house) which was amazing! The views were pretty cool and the room had all the usual amenities you would find at a good hotel. The breakfast is provided by the restaurant attached to the hotel, called the Royal host. The breakfast was a mix of continental and traditional local cuisine. Checkin was smooth, everyone was very helpful and professional. The pyjama's were a nice touch, the bed was comfortable and I would definitely recommend to friends and family. It's a 10min walk to Tokyo station you fancied it, the area is very laid back.

Terrific hotel, very close to the subway and easily accessible from Narita via Ueno. Breakfast in the attached restaurant was terrific with plenty of choices. A few restaurants close by with Western food available, Royal Host and Denny’s. Of course plenty of Japanese food close by as well. Rooms a good size and very modern. Close to Tokyo and Ginza subway stations. All in a all a very nice hotel and would stay again. Staff great and very helpful.

We stayed three nights and found this to be a quiet, well run, comfortable hotel in Tokyo 2 minutes to the Hachobori subway station and about 15 minutes walk from the Central Tokyo Station.Reception staff are friendly and speak English. The room was clean and comfortable with plenty of space to hang clothes. There is the usual TV, bar refrigerator (un-stocked) hair dryer and electric jug for tea/coffee making. There is free wifi in the rooms.The usual extras such as tea, coffee, shower caps, hand cream etc are available at a stand in reception. There is a 'Lawson' convenience store across the road.The buffet breakfast has both Japanese and Western items on the menu. Newspapers are free.Well recommended.

Great location close to Tokyo station and within walking distance to Ginza. Hotel is spotlessly clean and the bed was also very comfortable. Nice staff in the reception. Breakfast is ok for European tastes.

Went to Japan twice and stayed more than 5 hotels, this is the best one! would definitely stay again if back to Tokyo.Stayed 5 nights this time. The room space is considered quite large (27 m²) in Japan. Super near to metro station. Just a traffic light away (30 meters) from Hatchobori metro station A4 exit. Lawsons & Familymart are just downstairs across the road. Location is quite good, one station to Tsukiji Market and two stations to Ginza. From hotel 700yen taxi fare to Tokyo Station, from there you can take direct bus to Narita Airport which costs only 1000yen/pax and 60 mins only.

We have stayed at the Hotel Sardonyx Tokyo several times - our next stay is in the first week of March 2019. This Hotel is very clean and well serviced - and the rooms are spacious. The Reception staff are excellent. This Hotel is literally across the road from Hatchobori Metro Station. It is also only a fifteen minute walk to Tokyo Station, which has an amazing underground shopping mall. We visit Tokyo several times a year for personal and professional reasons, and we will continue to stay at this lovely Hotel.

We stayed twin room for 11 nights here. Room was spacious and clean. Bed was semi double so could two people can sleep which we did. Our daughter came over from Korea. All staff were very nice and helpful. Breakfast is very limited selection.

Our room was next to a family, including a screaming baby, but as soon as you entered the room, the walls were well sound proofed and we didn't hear a peep! Exactly what we wanted after a long flight. Staff good, wifi good, breakfast ok, price decent and location to Tokyo station really good. We would definitely return.

Stayed at the hotel with the family during +10 nights. Room: The size of the rooms are large if compared to Japanese standard. We had 3 beds and there were plenty of room to put luggage, etc. The beds where comfortable and big in size and toilet was pretty modern with a good shower. The room was good isolated and we didn’t hear any noice from outside. The rooms was very clean and cleaned perfect on-demand. Thumbs up for the cleaner Kayama!The wi-fi was good and we didn’t have any problems with connection during our stay. The tv channels were lacking a bit since other hotels I stayed at had a larger variety of channels. Location: the hotel is litteraly outside Hatchobori Metro station or a 10 min walk from Tokyo station. Outside there are many resturaunts and stores which are open 24/7. Metro station takes you to all destinations needed during Tokyo stay. Service: The service was great as expected from Japan. The reception staff speaks fluently english and are helpful. There are computers and printers to use in the lobby and as well other products for use as maps, etc..This is by far the best hotel I stayed at in Japan. I recommend it and will most likely stay here again!

We booked a triple room and were given 3 super single beds. Family of 3 adults and 2 kids. Pushed 2 beds together and it’s spacious enough to sleep 3. Room is also spacious enough for me to open 2 big luggage bags with enough space for the kids to play. Room is clean and modern and toilet is also bigger than the usual ones. Nearest train station is Hatchobori which is less than 1 min away. There is a Lawson opp the street and quite a number of restaurants around. I find Hatchobori station quite a convenient one to get me to places . There are a few other stations that are within walking distance to the hotel. Tokyo station is about 10-15 mins walk based on other reviews. Would definitely stay at this hotel again if I am visiting Tokyo

The hotel is about 15 to 20 mins walk from Tokyo Station (walk straight all the way from Yaesu South Exit). The Hatchobori metro station is just across the road and convenient to get to other stations. We love the various convenient stores around the hotel eg Lawson is across the road, Family Mart nearby, many eateries around the area. The hotel is clean and comfortable. Our family of 4 booked into a triple sharing room and it was comfortable with sufficient space. Courteous and polite staff. We were there for 3 nights and enjoyed the convenience as we commute by train.Vending machines with hot and cold bottled drinks are available at designated levels. Microwave and washing machine are also available at certain level.

Overall room cleanliness is excellent and tidy but too small for 3 people to stay comfortably. Staff was polite and helpful, however, I find it hard to communicate with them in English but they do understanding my need to lend me an AC adaptor which helps me a lot to get all my gadgets working.

We took the bus from Haneda to Tokyo Station (Y1860 for 2) & then a taxi to the hotel (Y800) as tired after a long flight but walking would have been about 20 mins straight up Yaesu Dori. Check-in was fast & had a twin room (#1012)with view of the river & street. The room was clean, quite large & relatively new, beds were large & had room to walk around both plus room for our bags. The room had everything, TV, fridge, safe, kettle (tea/coffee), work desk, chair, lamp, pyjamas, slippers, pants press,fully stocked bathroom plus more available in lobby. The room darkening curtains worked very well. Also available food & beverage vending machines, laundry, microwave & more. There is a Royal Host restaurant attached with a buffet breakfast discount for hotel guests. This seems like a business/Japanese tourist hotel so the buffet was virtually all Japanese which was great, all sorts of items we've never had before. They also had some breads, fruit, yogurt, muesli, scrambled eggs & hash browns. There is a Lawson & Family Mart across the street plus 2 grocery stores as little farther up the street towards Tokyo Station, Maruetsu petit is a great place to pick up a huge variety of take away foods at reasonable prices, only about a block away across the street with a green awning. Overall, impressed with the hotel, couldn't find fault, nice check-in & front desk service, some useful local area maps& English newspaper provided in the lobby, nice rooms, quiet, good wi-fi (included) attached Royal Host restaurant and decent location 15-20 min walk to Tokyo Station & to the heart of the Ginza. It is a bit out of the way but we liked the hotel so much would stay again if in the area.

Good hotel and room. Walk straight out of Tokyo JR Central exit. Only there overnight, early Shinkansen next day. Staff were helpful forwarding luggage, good English. We ate at the restaurant, food was fine, variety on the menu. Recommended.

I had good room with 2 queen beds. The room was large for Japan. Had a good disc for the laptop and the WiFi worked very good. I can recommend this hotel and would stay here again.Breakfast was okay, but there is room for improvement. The shower is in the bathtub and not made for tall persons. Everything nice and clean.

Is great comfortable hotel. We were able to walk to Subway nearby, although we have to make transfers. Make sure to purchase a 3 days unlimited subway with your airport express. There is FamilyMart and Lawson 24hrs store next to Hotel.

We were so happy with this hotel, which was our last stay in our country wide holiday. The room was very spacious, and location is convenient. A quiet area in terms of Tokyo standards. The bed was very comfortable! We appreciated the staff and their kindness. They helped us to get a last minute reservation to a Michelin star restaurant for celebrations. Will definitely stay here again.

Located in the Ginza business district and only 1 stop away from Ginza shopping street. Metro station just across the road - which you can get pretty much to everywhere. Tokyo Station just 15 min walk.The room is spacious and the staff are very friendly. The front desk speak English also Chinese which was quite helpful for us since my sister can speak Mandarin. We booked the rooms along with breakfast option, great food and plenty to choose from.Overall friendly staff, spacious room, great location and value.

Incredibly friendly multilingual staff!Spent 2 weeks in this hotel for a trip overseas, and couldn't have asked for a better stay. Only a 15 minute walk to the main train station that will bring you literally everywhere. The amenities provided were more than enough and included everything from lotions, hair wax's, sick masks and teas to bath salts, which came in quite handy after a nonstop day of sightseeing and such. Across the street are all the conveniences stores you would need for everything from supplies to full blown meals.

We like this hotel. Rooms are comfortable . Service is very polite and etricient. Excellent buffet breakfast. Lobby has nice freebies, that have tea, toiletries and makeup.Good access to the subway and plentiful taxis available. Very close to the Ginza

Decent hotel located within walking distance of Tokyo station and Ginza district. The rooms were quite spacious considering what's generally on offer in Tokyo. Also, if staying for more than a few days, the fact you can do your own laundry within the hotel is very handy. We stayed 4 nights and had breakfast here twice. Again, this was good value although you may want to mix it up as we did by eating elsewhere on other occasions. Staff were helpful although I recommend that you get them to indicate directions on a map, whenever possible. Also, if arriving early, you are unlikely to be allowed to check in early - be prepared to pay for a few hours or go away and do other things until your check-in time.

Welwyn Garden City, United Kingdom

review_body: We stayed for 7 nights. Room was cleaned every day, Staff were very helpful and polite. 10 min walk to Tokyo Central Station. Big room with a safe. Good selection of food at breakfast and it was included in the price of the room. Subway access across the road to the hotel. Drinks machines on each floor. Fridge and tea/coffee and kettle in room. 1 downside, only 1 English speaking channel on tv. National Geographic or a sitcom channel would be good.

The Sardonyx is close to Central Railway Station, conveniently one kilometre away and an easy walk.The area is very quiet, with loads of nearby eateries and mini-marts. There is a subway station across the road which further enhances the convenience of this hotel.The rooms themselves are great. Super clean and well maintained. Excellent water pressure, good beds and great air-con which is virtually silent. For those that smoke, the fifth floor is a designated smoking level but there is an isolated room on that floor where many smoke, saving their rooms ... If you know what l mean. There is a in-house laundry room where one can wash your own clothes ... Two washers and a dryer are in the room and are coin operated. Ice machines are also available on different floors as is another room with a microwave and drinks vending machine. There is a franchise restaurant on the ground floor. Buffet breakfast is available as part of your room booking if you choose that option. Otherwise, great coffee shops such as Veloce abound. The staff are fantastic and ever helpful. The maids cheerfully say hello as they pass and front desk staff go out of their way to help with useful infrmation etc.

My friends and I (there were 3 of us) were staying at this hotel for our one night transit to the US. Location is very good, since it is close to Tokyo Station (walking distance), the Hatchobori Subway Station (which is just across the hotel), and Hatchobori JR Station. If you intend to visit Tsukiji Market, it is very close as well to the hotel, you might go by foot if you want to have some exercises, otherwise it was just 2 stations away.The hotel room was big and nice (comparing to the usually small hotel room in Tokyo). And the price is reasonable as well for the quality it provides. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel and would likely comeback again if I visit Japan in the future.

This hotel is the best we had throughout our trip in Japan. For its price (a little less than 100eur), the location and room quality is perfect. The room is very spacious (similar to a European/American standard). The staff speaks English and the front desk provides various free amenities. The hotel is nearly next to the Hatchobori JR line station, and just a 20min walk from Tokyo station. The borough is quiet and seems like a business district. Many mini markets, a super market and small restaurants are located in the streets close by.

We stayed in the Hotel Sardonyx for 3 nights and very much enjoyed our time there. The rooms are spacious by Japanese standards and the beds are big. The robes and slippers to be worn in the rooms are a nice touch, as are the complimentary toiletries, amenities, tea bags and local maps available at reception. The staff are very friendly and welcoming, and the hotel is extremely close to the subway and JR station so easy access to wherever you want to explore in Tokyo. It's proximity to Disney and Disney Sea means you can make the most of your time at the parks rather than travelling. It is walking distance to the shopping Mecca of Ginza (took us about 25 minutes at a leisurely pace) and the Tsukiji fish markets. Definitely recommend the breakfast at Royal Host (especially the pancakes!) - it's a great start to the day. We enjoyed exploring the streets around the hotel and relaxing with a walk along the river after a hard day's sightseeing. Recommend this hotel if you want a quiet, well-equipped place to stay in a relaxing part of Tokyo with lots of good local restaurants nearby.

The Good:• The front desk team was very welcoming and very helpful. Their English was very good. • They were helpful, providing assistance in finding a few things locally and supplied excellent tourist guides in English as well as maps. • Convenient to Tokyo Station. We stayed here one night after arriving in Tokyo via the airport express and next morning to taking the Shinkansen to Hiroshima. The hotel is about a 15-minute walk from the larger Tokyo station. Tokyo station has trains to/from the airport and most everywhere else.• Quiet, clean and safe. Our room on the 6th floor was quiet. The neighborhood was safe and clean. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from the larger Tokyo station. Tokyo station has trains to/from the airport and most everywhere else.• Close proximity to many restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner.• Vending machines with beer on our floor! Nice.• In-room safe.The Bad (more like the only negative things I could find)• We opted for the 3 beds in the room which makes the room a little tight. The Ugly• Nothing.

Hotel Sardonyx Tokyo is situated between two different subway stations, each only a few minutes away so it's really convenient. Also, the rooms are bright and more spacious than your typical Tokyo lodging.

Very strategically located near Hatchobori subway station. In fact the subway station and the Keio JR Line is just a few minutes walk. There are a few convenience stores nearby, no worries of getting necessities at any times. There are also plenty of eateries nearby, in particular Denny Restaurant which is 24 hours. The room size is big compared to the other same size hotels nearby. Would stay here again when come to Tokyo.

This particular hotel from an American standpoint offers alot for its price and location. Located close to the JR Tokyo station, with in walking distance. Now for Americans the room might seem small, but it just enough room for two people and luggage. The room was extremely clean and quite despite being on a main road. This particular room was well appointed with a mini fridge, TV, free decent wifi, and usual toiletries. If I was coming back to tokyo I would bypass the name brands and head to this gem of a hotel.

My boy and me stayed at the hotel. Was pleasantly surprised as i heard most Japanese places are relatively small, that was not the case though. Its quite spacious and nice layout. Room came with a bathtub, fan, and pants press. The TV non paying channels has only one english speaking channel. The hotel has drinks vending machine at most floors and washing machine with dryers at the 4th floor. The resturant below is pretty decent. You can use the subway which is just opposite the hotel. Getting there is ok. Just travel to Hatchobori Station on the Hibiya Line and use Exit A4. Long flight of stairs though. The hotel is just ahead across the road. Lots of places to eat nearby n family marts. Overall, nice place to stay

Me and my Husband had a wonderful honeymoon around Japan. And our last trip was Tokyo. So we both choose a very convenient place to stay. So we choose Sardonyx as our last place to stay. We both love this hotel. Despite of we had a room that near a street, we barely hear noises or getting disturb with the cars. Everything was perfect. We can get easily to the nearest station which is Hatchobori. Overall we both enjoyed and loved Tokyo so much, also Sardonyx has stole our heart and we marked it to be one of the best hotel in Tokyo.

Stayed for 4 nights and all was good. Room size was good for this level of hotel. Room was clean and had all usual amenities. We had breakfast in the restaurant a couple of times and good value with pancakes made to order. Location was excellent close to Tokyo main station but also a couple of subway lines. This made transfer from Haneda easy without having to change. Staff were friendly and efficient.

I stayed here several times on business. Nothing special, just your typical Tokyo business hotel. However the rooms tend to be pretty spacious. The location is within walking distance of plenty of food places, Hatchobori Station, and Tokyo Station, so it's convenient if you need to take the train. I wouldn't recommend it for tourists.

This hotel is tucked away at the corner of Tokyo’s business district. The lobby is cosy and check-in was smooth. Room is clean and everything is functioning. There was no usual complimentary bottled water in the room,but a water cooler machine is available outside. Complimentary wifi was great. Buffet breakfast spread was very average with minimal vegetarian options.

We were very happy with the space in our twin room with 2 very comfortable double beds, fast Wi-Fi, bar fridge and hot water jug. The buffet breakfast was the best we had in Japan. There's a convenience store over the road, a subway and it took us about 25 minutes to walk to Tokyo station.

Love the hotel. Rooms are decent size for Tokyo standard. Laundry room available. Royal Host @ ground floor from 6am to 2am! Jonathan 100m away is a 24hr diner. My favourite late night retreat. Hatchobori station acrosst the road. Kayabacho station 10 minutes behind hotel. Both on hibiya subway line (if you have heavy luggage, use kayabacho; no elevator or escalotor at hatchobori station. Tokyo station is 15 minutes on foot. Convenient for shinkansen or narita express or disneyland ( disney also thru hatchobori station!).Finally, one big negetive point... its always fully booked..!

Stayed at Hotel Sardonyx for one night because of its proximity to Tokyo Station. I’m glad we weren’t planning to stay longer. The hotel is dated. Our room smelled of stale smoke (when we arrived we were told there was only one smoking room left). On the plus side, the staff was nice.

Modern hotel. Everything works. Very clean. Breakfast centers on Asian food with a few American type staples such as eggs, potato patties, cereal,etc. Bed very comfortable. Some street noise but double glazed windows. Quiet. On the 4th floor is a coin operated laundry which I found handy. I would stay here again

Located near to Tokyo station (10min walk), this is a no frills, clean and crisp hotel.It is in a quiet neighbourhood compared with the rest of Tokyo, but it was good to be able to go back to a hotel that has a more relaxed atmosphere.It is located just one metro stop away from the Tsukiji fish market, and 2 stops from Tokyo station.Ginza is with walking distance- 15mins, and there is a convenience store across the road (lawsons).The rooms are clean, the bed is comfortable and the washrooms are well designed. Compared to other rooms we stayed in, the size of the standard room was small but I would say this is an average sized room for a Tokyo hotel.There are coin operated washers and dryers- which made our trip a lot better too.The staff were very friendly and accommodating.I would stay here again.

Stayed here for 3 nights. I would say the room was a lot larger than what I have stayed elsewhere in Japan. I am glad I stayed here because after a long day walking around tokyo, I feel relieved everytime knowing i will be returning to a comfortable room with nice bed and shower room. The shower room has great water pressure, shampoo and conditioners are better quality than expected compared to the hotels in the US. Since it's close to tokyo station, the taxi fare is only 5-6 USD to ride to to tokyo station if you decided not to walk with heavy luggages to catch your shinkansen. I left my hair dryer at the hotel. I emailed them and they kept it for me, including my socks which I didn't even know I left it in the room. There is also a breakfast/brunch place next to the hotel called "Denny". They have extensive breakfast/brunch and desserts menu that will below your mind if you decided not to eat at the hotel. I would recommend this hotel whole heartedly.

Room was quiet large, very comfortable, and very quiet even though my room was overlooking a main road. And very clean. Subway station across the road is convenient for getting to popular places in Tokyo and Narita airport. Also a short walk to Tokyo station. Breakfast was good, a mixture of Japanese and western foods on offer.

From the size of the room was very satisfied and super comfortable in price wise. Luxurious and comfortable bed sheets and pillows.It's a little far from metro station but acceptable if compare to the hotels near shopping mall and tourism point all are very small and expensive. I rather walk a bit but have a luxurious comfortable sleep, so definitely will be back to Sardonyx. Walking distances to nearest station only about 500m Shower room full with complete amenities and surprisingly at the lobby you can choose your favorite tea or coffee, sea salt bath oil and many varieties of amenities. I will put my complete recommend video for better pictures in few weeks after my trip from USA

Booked through agoda for this hotel with a good reasonable price. Check in was quick and easy as the receptionist found my booking immediately.The rooms were big and spacious and the beds were super comfy. There are phone chargers in the drawer in case you forgot yours. The bathroom is more on the smaller side and was rather dark. Besides that, the bathroom is equipped with amenities and if that's not already enough, there is a shelf located in the lobby where you can get some extra amenities like face wash, face lotion, bath salts, teas, mouthwash, hair ties and etc... It is a great hotel, with Hatchobori Station (exit 4) located just across the road with Lawson just opposite too. Around the area, there are Yoshinoya ,Denny's and other eateries. Around 5 minutes walk to Maruetsu Petit, a supermarket. 20 minutes walk to Tokyo station and around 25 minutes walk to Tsukiji market. Overall, a good hotel for its value and space but the only complaint is that it is quite far to get to other areas like Shibuya, Shinjuku, Asakusa etc... so you'll have to take the train everyday to travel. Another thing... When I returned from Tokyo, I realized I left my glasses in the hotel. Emailed them immediately and they managed to find it right away. They helped mail it back to me which I am super grateful for how honest and kind they are!

We stayed at this hotel during our trip to Japan. Since we like the close vicinity to Ginza, Tokyo station and Tsukiji and away from the noisy area, we chose this hotel. As it turned out, this was one of the best mid-scale hotels in Tokyo we’ve stayed so far. The previous reviews on TripAdvisor assured their accuracy.LocationThe hotel is located right by the subway station of Hachobori. Across from the hotel is a 24-hour convenience store and next to it is a drug store. On the ground floor there is a kind of American style diner with a menu full of pictures. It is also a 15-min walking distance to Tokyo station. A few subway stops away from Ginza. Taxis are easy to catch on every street corner. We stayed on the 2nd floor right above the street, but we did not hear any noise from the street. Since there are mainly offices in Hachobori, it’s quiet all day and on the weekend you hardly see people. There are a lot of good and cheap eateries targeting businessmen for lunch and dinner nearby.Front staffI was impressed by the language skill of the front staff. There was no miscommunication, which can happen a lot in Japan, and the staff was always friendly and attentive to our small demands. Once we asked for children’s PJ, and they really had a set and they even came with cute slippers! Another day, I complained that the washlet in the toilet was not working. 1 hour later it was already fixed. Since it was a Halloween season, there was a game for children to collect Halloween items hidden in the lobby. My child was thrilled about the game and happy when the front desk staff gave a bag of cute Japanese snacks as a gift. The hotel makes an effort to please even the smallest guests. We also appreciated that we could leave our luggages before check in and while we were away for the weekend trip without extra charge. RoomThe room is smaller than the photo but is practically designed. The amenities are minimum, but there is a shelf in the lobby with all sorts of giveaway amenities like bath salt, makeup remover or cotton pad. One thing we missed in the room was the storage space for our big suitcases. WiFi was not as fast as back at home. Since we mostly spent time outside the hotel sightseeing, we did not mind the small room size.We will definitely come back here on our future trip to Japan and recommend this hotel to other travelers as well.

We had a twin bed which was very accommodating, since we are staying with 2 of our kids. The room is considered sufficient for us and our 5 luggages and a baby stroller. The hotel have laundry room on the 4th floor, which is very convenient if you are travelling for more than a week in Japan. The Metro(subway) is just right across the hotel. Ginza will have 3 stops, and 1 stop to Tsukiji. We were surprised to receive a Christmas gift on our door, which we had never experienced in any of the hotels we stayed. The Hotel staff also helped us to recover our shopping bag that was left inside the trunk of a taxi.We would love to come back

Beautiful hotel, nice, clean room. Very pleasant staff. In the centar of the city. They have good breakfast in the restoran. Tray table could be more clean. Anyhow I will remember this place as one of good and pleasant place which I visit in my life.

We stayed there for 5 nights before Christmas time. The surrounding was so quiet but safe. Even though we booked small double, the room was big (by Tokyo standard) that can fit 2 people and 2 big luggage with plenty of room to walk. What I like most is a massage chair the hotel provide in the room. It can help relaxing after a long day of walking. Overall I would recommend for travellers who want quiet place and don't mind to connect many subway or JR routes to other interesting places.

We booked a triple room for a one night stay to break up a journey from Narita to Kyoto after an evening arrival in Japan.Whilst the room had the required bed space, it was probably on the small size.It was quite difficult to manoeuvre around the room, particularly because the free space seemed to be taken up by unnecessary furniture. That aside, the room was clean, beds comfy and bathroom maintained to a good standard.I probably would not want to stay here as a family of 4 for more than one night as the space would be insufficient. However, for a quick night sleep before a morning shinkansen, this hotel was perfectly adequate.

We found this hotel to be very nice, comfortable and in a great location. Hatchobori metro station is right outside the hotel and the JR line is just a block further. The JR line goes directly to Maihama station for Disneyland and only takes about 20 min to get there. There is a Lawsons and a Dennys next door to the hotel as well. The staff were very friendly and the room was quite large for Japan standards.

We stayed on this hotel for 4 days during our stay in Tokyo. It is very convenient as has a metro station next by. The rooms was very clean. We reserved a room for 2 adults and a kid. They just had a sofa for the kid which is not comfortable or made for a person to sleep. We needed to ask for additional linens and towel, even though the reservation was for 3 persons. Overall I recommended it for 2 persons.

We stayed here for a week in Oct/Nov. It's a stone's throw away from the subway line and less than 5 mins walk away from the JR line to Disneyland. There's a supermarket, pharmacy and numerous convenience stores around the hotel. There is a self service laundromat on the 4th floor, which was handy when you travel with kids.Room was modern, clean and spacious. Service was exceptional.We would definitely stay here again if we visit Tokyo in the future.

The Hotel is of good quality and the rooms have a good size for Tokyo-standard. They equip you with the standard amenities. Nothing is missing. The breakfast was also Japan standard plus and the kids enjoyed the pancakes. Not far from the station. No problem to walk even though you have to bring a suitcase.

We stayed three nights here. Its location is excellent if you want something a little way from the noise and bright lights of the Ginza. a 25 minute walk from Tokyo station, or you could get the subway to Hatchobori, from where its only 10 mins. The surrounding blocks are mainly offices, so fairly quest in the evenings, but with plenty of restaurants to choose from. The staff were courteous and efficient - even the cleaning lady was a cheerful ambassador for her employer! Our room was well appointed with good views down the nearby river.The restaurant used for breakfast is actually next door to the hotel. Again, cheerful and helpful staff, but for a western-style hotel the food was very Japanese in taste.

Located right next to a train station with a restaurant and convenience store on the ground level, everything was much easier for an international traveller. Breakfast is nothing fantastic but there's enough choice to satisfy most (traditional Japanese with savoury and eggs, sausage, yoghurt and fruit for the westerners). The coffee is basic (no flat whites or cappuccinos) and I don't think there was any cereal.The wifi is fast and reliable and included in the room but the TV is not what I'm used to in US OR Australia with lots of basic channels to channel surf on. It is more on demand programs and only CNN for news. Loved the bed, not too hard as some colleagues have complained about in other Tokyo hotels. The bathroom amenities are also top notch with toothbrush, toothpaste, slippers etc provided and replenished daily. Plus the warmed toilet seat, bidets of course which is standard fare in Japan is such a luxury.

We needed a hotel close by to Tokyo station as we had to catch the Narita express to the airport the following day. We scored a night at Hotel Sardonyx on the cheap side through Agoda and were pleasantly suprised when we checked-in.We were greeted with a smile by some friendly staff who allowed us to check-in to our room a couple of hours early. They also held our bags after check-out while we got our last few hours to wander around Tokyo.The room was the biggest surprise. After nights in small, compact apartments, we expected another cramped space. This was not the case though. We had opened the door to an incredibly spacious and tidy room - we hit the jackpot with this deal. It had a great sized bed, couch, table and wall mounted TV with ample space to still move around comfortably. The bathroom was also very generous with a nice sized bath. Everything was clean and well maintained.Hotel Sardonyx Tokyo is about a 15 minute walk from Tokyo station, however you can catch the Keiyo Line or Tokyo Metro Hibiya Line to Hatchobori station and take an exit that is literally a minute walk to the hotel. We found the Hibiya Line convenient to get to places like Akihabara or to transfer to other lines to get to the busier places like Shinjuku and Shibuya, all of which were about a 15-20 minute ride. The area in which the hotel is located seems to be more of a business district so it was relatively quiet on the Sunday we stayed with not much happening at night. There are some fast food diners and a 7-Eleven close by.This proved to be a really nice stay for our last night. Hard to believe it's only a 3-star rated hotel.

I am very satisfied with the staff and the facilities in Sardonyx. ProsLocation - it is a 10 minute walk from the airport limousine bus stop located across Tokyo station where also the long distance buses are. If weather is good and you don't have too much luggage it is very convenient. Hatchobori station is just a minute away. It is also just a few metro stops to Disney. Convenience stores Lawsons and Family mart are just outside. A supermarket is also nearby.Room - thoroughly cleaned, spacious and comfortable.Amenities - very convenient to get some ice cubes, buy drinks at vending machines and do your laundry at selected floors. Washing your clothes needs at least 200yen and drying 100 yen.Front desk - very helpful and friendly. I mistakenly booked a smoking room and was not able to get a new room since they were fully booked. Once a non-smoking room was available two days later, they called and asked if I wanted to change which of course I did. Restaurants - there are a few restaurants outside. For simple Japanese food, we were happy with the food from Denny's and Jonathan's. They offer western food as well. If you want sushi or yakiniku, ask the front desk. They have a list of restaurants nearby.ConsBreakfast - the food is the same every day. So if you are staying for more than two days, skip breakfast here and go to Jonathan's or Denny's. Or buy something simple at Lawsons. TipsBath salts, male and female toiletries, masks, and few items are available for free at the lobby. Imperial Garden where the Palace is located is at least 15 minute walk from hotel. Walk straight to Tokyo station and find the Manchouri Line exit. Taking the metro from Hatchobori will take you almost the same time since you need to transfer lines.

A fantastic experience again! We first stayed here in 11/2015 and now again in 5/2017; and both experiences were 1st rate! Predominately, a business hotel, it is in a quiet area not to far from the main Tokyo train station (which is an easy taxi ride or a nice 15-20 min. walk), and subways and buses are just steps away. The room sizes are large by Japanese standards, and very comfortable. I especially like the desks which are large and sturdy enough to hold my 40lb luggage, making it easy to pack and repack. It has a Royal Host restaurant downstairs, which is convenient, but there are also tons of places to eat nearby. The Japanese convenience stores are numerous in this area and are the perfect stop for all your needs, some of my favorite meals in Japan are the sandwiches and bento boxes which are so fresh they are restocked twice a day, and if you want your bento heated up they'll do that too. If you are into shopping, a short distance away is the Ginza with everything you could ever dream of. When we travel to Tokyo we will always stay at the Hotel Sardonyx Tokyo!

Though we had to walk about 15mins from Tokyo JR station, Hatchobori station was 1-2min walk from the hotel. We were greeted by polite staff upon our arrival. I was concerned if the room would not be as big as shown on the booking site, for it was stated as 'Small double room', but, it turned out that the room was spacious and comfortable! Not only it has a double bed, it could accomodate an L-shaped writing table and a long couch by the window. We asked for a higher floor room facing the river and we were given it. The room was also very clean.Besides complimentary toiletries in the room, the hotel also stocked up a shelf full of complimentary skin care products, and tea sachets at the lobby.There were also complimentary newspapers in English and Japanese near the lift lobby. There is a cafe at first floor that has a cosy setting. It starts its business as early as 6.30am, but we did not give it a try due to our short stay.There is no airport transfer service for this hotel, despite being given the option on the 3rd party booking website. However, the hotel staff was helpful in giving us direction. A 5min taxi ride (cost merely 570¥) brought us to the limousine bus terminal to both Narita and Haneda airports. If you hold a foreign passport, you can get bus tickets at 1900¥ instead of 3000¥. Bus leaves every 15minutes, and takes about an hour to reach Narita airport.If you prefer a hotel located at the quieter side of the city, near to a train station, plus spacious room with reasonable price, this is it. We will choose this hotel again.

This was our second time staying at the Hotel Sardonyx Tokyo and we enjoyed it just as much as the first time. The hotel is modern, clean, near Tokyo station, and has very large rooms, especially for Japan. Our semidouble room had a double bed, as well as a sitting area with couch and coffee table, giving us a ton of room to unpack our bags and relax. The bed is a bit firm but on par with most Japanese hotels, making it comfortable enough.  It’s in a quiet business area east of Tokyo station, not much of a sightseeing neighbourhood. However it’s an easy walk to Tokyo station, the Tsukiji fish market, and Ginza. It’s a great place to stay when you first arrive in Tokyo as your jet lag will likely have you up early making it the perfect time to head to the Tsukiji fish market.  To get to Tokyo station it’s about a 15 minute walk or a 5 minute subway ride. We found the walk very reasonable, though it may not be ideal for those who don’t like to walk as much.  Overall this is an excellent place to stay, I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in Tokyo as long as they don’t need the busy city right at their door.

Our room was on the side of the hotel & higher up so it was quiet. The room was large by Japanese hotel standards and was comfortable & very clean. There was not a lot of storage. The bathroom was large enough & came with all the amenities you could want. Breakfast was buffet style in the restaurant adjacent to the hotel & was very good with a large selection of western & Asian fare. They will also make a cheese omelet or pancakes on request. It is near a subway and about a 20 minute walk or a quick bus ride to Tokyo Train & Subway Station. There are lots of different styles of restaurants close by & within walking distance. There is a self-serve laundry on one floor that is very handy.

This was our second stay at Sardonyx, about a year after our last visit. While the main points about the hotel were the same (good location, much larger rooms than average for Tokyo, cheap coin-operated laundry on site) and reception were even a little friendlier than before, our room really wasn't very clean. There were some sticky food marks on the lounge and carpet, and a very hard old bread roll hiding in the dust under the bed. The bathroom was however spotless, and bed linen was fresh.

I don't know what exactly happened with one of the previous reviewers, and I'm sorry he/she had such a bad experience. I read that review only much after I booked at Sardonyx and it honestly got me concerned. Luckily, I worried in vain: The hotel is top, modern and clean! Located strategically well (close to main station, close to metro stations), we were greeted, we were taken care of and were accompanied in our room. The room was rather large for Asian/Japanese hotels, we enjoyed it very much. The bathroom was small, but had lots of amenities and was spotless. Everything was clean, the employees were very friendly and helpful and we enjoyed the quiet so much (usually in hotels you happen to hear the neighbours because of thin walls). We never heard a single word or any noise. The microwave we used (on floor 8?) was spotless, like the elevator and everything else. I don't agree with dust, I have a couple of allergies and I didn't have any problem in the room. Wifi was superfast, yay! We enjoyed our three nights stay in Sardonyx very much and would recommend it 100%.

On the third day after the stay, finally unbearable, we contacted the front desk staff, we would like to ask her to come to our room to see the situation and face to face communication, but she can not personally come to our room,she only sent a cleaning staff who could only speak Japanese and could not communicate with us by language come to our room, and we have to use body language to tell the cleaning staff the room was very dirty, the cleaner kept nodding, but after we returned to my room at night, we found that only a few parts has been cleaned up, most other parts Is still very dirty.Because we don't understand Japanese, English is also general, and the daily energy spent on tourism, So we do not have sufficient capacity, and full time and energy to continue to communicate with the hotel.  we have returned home for 7 days, but that The room is full of dust and stains scene has been in my eyes flashed, one by one question emerge in my heart,you did not do your job well, is your dereliction of duty. As I write this, I am on the 10th day staying at this hotel. I am on vacation with my 18 year old son in Tokyo and this hotel is really no dissapointment. First and gore most, for the price and location, it us gard to beat. A 15 minute walk from Tokyo Station, we never bothered with the Hatchabori Metro Station just in front of the hotel. Tsukiji market is just one stop away. The rooms are decent and clean and the service here is impeccable. I will stay here again for future Tokyo trips and would recommend it to all.

Stayed 4 nights for business nearby. This is situated at commercial area 1 minutes from Hatchobori Station Hibiya line, 10mins direct bus to Tokyo station and Ariake/Tokyo Big Sight. %mins taxi to TCAT and 30mins to Haneda. Surrounding with 24 hours mini -market, convenient stores and restaurants.Rooms are large in Tokyo's Japan business hotel standard, my twin bedroom is 27Sqm with decent size of bathroom and bathtub. Very clean and well maintained. The hotel provides all kinds of amenities that is free pick up form a rack next at reception counter. Front desks are nice and efficient. Only deduction is the over priced breakfast, 1300JPY for so call buffet breakfast at Royal Host - which this restaurants in all over Japan serves breakfast in different set except this chain- buffet only. You may have 2 minutes walk to "Jonathan" at next door, not it is great but not as over charged and without choice (I dislike anything without choice...).

Stayed here as part of a tour. While I probably would not have selected it myself, it was extremely clean, modern, and close to the subway and Ginza area.The front desk staff is excellent, very pleasant and helpful. I left something important behind in the room safe and they mailed it to me at my next location, at no cost, so a very big arigatou from me!

A good location located near a few subway stops. Not much selection of restaurants within walking distance but the few that were nearby were very good. Very friendly and helpful staff. I accidentally booked my flight out of Haneda airport way too early when the subway trains were not in operation. The staff went above and beyond in getting me a reasonably priced taxi service so that i wouldn't miss my flight.

A good place for our family stay. After staying in several guesthouses - lovely, but where noise and mess had to be very strictly controlled - this hotel was a nice change of scenery - a spacious hotel room where our kids could have pillow fights and let out some steam. Also very handy was the park with play equipment a few blocks away. Trains and metro are very close by, and the big fancy shopping destination Ginza is a short interesting walk away. This is not the tourist mecca of Shinjuku or Shibuya but still a fine place to stay in Tokyo - it's where you can escape to after a big day out. There were many good restaurants within walking distance too and we had no complaints about the breakfast buffet. I recommend the pancakes! If you are only staying in one place in Japan and you've never been before, you won't get the full experience if you stay here as it's a Western style hotel. But if it's part of a larger trip I can recommend it.

Friendly staff. Clean and compact room Basically, small room with 3 large single beds. We were one hour earlier before check-in time and allowed to leave our luggage at the lobby. When we returned later, our luggage were already brought to our room. Pleasant place to stay.

Stayed for 5 nights in early July. The hotel is located in close proximity of metro station. Two mini markets open 24hrs and are located opposite to the hotel. Rooms are quite big compared with other Japanese standard hotels. The Bed size is very comfortable for 1A and 1C. We stayed in twin bed rooms which accomodates 2A and 2C. Bed quality is also good and we have no complaints during our stay. We'd definitely recommend this hotels to our fam and colleague.

Pleasant hotel with helpful, friendly staff. Location suited us perfectly being in a fairly quiet spot, just 30 seconds from a subway station and 15 mins walk from Tokyo's main railway station. There's no hotel restaurant. There is a restaurant next door but we didn't use it having seen poor reviews of it. However about a third of the walk from the hotel to/from Tokyo station can be done through an underground mall which has any number of eateries and cafes.The only real disappointment was the storage space in the room. The room itself was quite large (we went for a double not a semi-double), clean and airy with a nice bathroom but apart from a wardrobe with a long hanging rail (which after using the 6 hangers supplied was useless) there was no clothes storage, i.e. no shelves or drawers. Above the wardrobe was a blank panel; one side of the room was dominated by a floor-to-ceiling TV unit with no shelves; the bedside cabinets had a small sliding tray but the body of the units were blank panels which didn't open; and one end of the room had a large desk whose pedestal was again a blank unit not drawers. We had to open our suitcase on the desk and, apart from hanging up some shirts and trousers, live directly out of it. Such a shame and such poor room design.

My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Sardonyx Chuo for five nights in April 2016 and thought that it was a decent 3 star hotel with some serious positives and only one drawback. The staff at the hotel were lovely. We were greeted upon arrival and were checked into our room quickly and without any fuss. I've stayed at 5 star hotels in Asia in the past and have had to wait much longer to be checked-in upon being served. We stayed on the sixth floor. The hotel is small so each floor has different amenities. Our floor had vending machines which stocked a selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks and an ice machine. Other floors had microwaves and laundry facilities. We never used those so I can't say what they were like unfortunately. There are no fitness or gym facilities at this hotel. Our room was small but comfortable with a low double bed, writing desk, sofa and luggage compartment. There is a very small closet with room for six pieces of clothing. Under the bedside table is a programmable safe. The room has reverse-cycle air conditioning as well. Other room amenities included free wifi, a TV (only Japanese language stations), a kettle, tea and coffee, cups and glasses, shoe shining/cleaning equipment, fabric deodoriser, robes and slippers. There was a small bathroom attached with a bath/shower combo and a toilet (including the obligatory space-age Japanese toilet seat). Bathroom amenities included a hairdryer, razors, toothbrush/toothpaste, hair brush, disposable face cloth and cotton tips. The shower was small but had good water pressure. Shower gel, shampoo and conditioner were also provided. Importantly the bathroom was very clean and the cleaning staff do a great job. During our stay we requested extra pillows and they were delivered promptly and at no extra cost. The hotel is an easy 15 minute stroll from Tokyo Station and is within easy walking distance from three different metro lines. Hatchobori Station is a minute away while Nihombashi, Takaracho and Kyobashi stations are no more than 10 minutes walk away. There are a variety of convenience stores located nearby (Lawsons and Family Mart are both across the road). Our room rate included breakfast which is served in a Royal Host restaurant next to the lobby. It is open to the public and seemed to be a common place for local business people to meet. Despite that we never had trouble getting a seat regardless of the time we started breakfast. Breakfast was a buffet and included a small selection of Japanese, Chinese and Western cuisines. All in all we enjoyed our stay at the hotel Sardonyx and would definitely stay again. The only negative that we experienced was the occasional noise. It can sometimes be busy on weekday mornings and evenings and the noise filters into the rooms. You can also hear your neighbours very clearly so if you're looking for peace and quiet, this hotel may not be for you.

Although the rooms are smallish by US standards, the location is convenient. You can enjoy diverse restaurants, cafes, and walking along the river. Our room had a great view of both water and a small shrine. It's definitely not glitzy, but is good value, location and comfortable. As I was part of a group tour, I didn't select this hotel, but would consider staying there again.

Stayed here for three nights, our first stay inJapan. It's a mile walk from Tokyo station so not too bad and straight down a main road from the Yeasu central exit so easy to find. We were welcomed by an English speaking reception and they stored our luggage before taking it to the room when it was ready. Room was small but big enough, bathroom was also small but again big enough with a bath and plenty of hot water. WiFi was free and high speed. There was also a tv with local channels, there was supposed to be CNN but we couldn't find it. Breakfast was expensive for what it was and lacked any cereals that a westerner might normally expect but there was a good selection of savouries. Overall I really liked this hotel, we had no trouble getting out to the main attractions from her, there is a subway station really close, and the tourist areas are really chaotic with masses of neon everywhere. It was nice to get away from that in the evening. There are also plenty of restaurants in the area. Price was very reasonable compared to other places we are staying at 16000 yen with breakfast. I've rated it quiet, which it is for a city but it's not quiet in the sense of being out in a rural hotel.

Modern hotel, very friendly staff. The room we had was a good size and definitely larger than most rooms in Tokyo. View from room of the area with a bit of canal too. On site restaurant looked a bit quiet so we never tried it - there are plenty of other eateries in the area.

Excellent service, great amenities, very clean, well located, good breakfast buffet. Not a fancy hotel but a great place to stay. Desk service excellent and would stay here again. Wifi is free and fast, easy to use.

This is a very ordinary hotel in an uninteresting neighborhood. The single room I stayed in was nondescript, slightly grim, and faced a busy street with traffic. The worst part of my stay was the unresponsiveness of the front desk. I had requested a quiet room in the morning, when I had dropped of my bags around 9:30 a.m.--the woman at the desk said she would try. When I returned in the afternoon to check in, I was told by the same woman that there are no quiet rooms because all the single rooms faced the street. Why had she not told me this in the morning? As I tried to explain to her that she had said she would try to find a quiet room, four of the front desk staff stood there and stared at me in an unfriendly fashion. Most Japanese staff people are very polite so this behavior was unusual and unpleasant. I had a second reservation at this hotel later in my trip, which I promptly cancelled. I cannot recommend this hotel and will not be going back.
